1.title: Guilty Pleasures
1.plot: Check out restaurants that push the envelope on America's beloved foods. Innovative takes on classic comfort foods result in guilty pleasures.

2.title: Hotlanta
2.plot: Check out a few eateries that make Atlanta, Georgia a hotbed for unique eats. Dishes include Korean and America BBQ.

3.title: Swine
3.plot: Americans continue to pine for swine. Learn the most unique pork dishes, including a Korean BBQ restaurant that features eight flavors of bacon.

4.title: Ethnic Eats
4.plot: Authentic global flavors can be savored right here in America, including the Mediterranean and Israeli flavors at "Balaboosta" in New York City; inside "Riff's Fine Street Food" truck in Nashville.

5.title: Chi-Town
5.plot: Chicago draws foodies from across the country with their fresh restaurants, including the innovative "Publican Quality Meats".

6.title: Hot Lunch Spots
6.plot: Perla in NYC serves Italian sandwiches and delicious pizzas. It's the unique "baco" sandwich served at Baco Mercat in LA. At Local Three Kitchen and Bar, fast food classics are guilt-free because only fresh ingredients are used.

7.title: Modern Italian
7.plot: Foodies across the country put their modern spin on some Italian classics, including Italian-American sandwiches; inside gastropub "Alla Spina" in Philadelpia.

8.title: Innovators
8.plot: Innovative chefs are creating uniquely modern food across the country. Included: a visit to chef Paul Qui's Austin restaurant, "East Side King"; and Matt Lightner's culinary theater.

9.title: Small Bites
9.plot: Sample everything on the menu when it comes in the form of small bites, including a variety of Latin-American ceviche dishes in Miami, Florida.

10.title: Old School
10.plot: Yardbird, in Miami, offers up southern flair with fried chicken and green tomatoes; classic sandwiches in Philadelphia.

11.title: Reinvention
11.plot: We love classic dishes but, especially when chefs uniquely reinvent them.

12.title: New Asian
12.plot: In Austin, an authentic ramen house takes classic broths and adds intense flavors. Thai food has reached the people of Austin with Sway. In Brooklyn, Dassara reshapes brunch favorites like bagels and lox into an Asian noodle dish.

13.title: Brooklyn Rising
13.plot: Celebrated chefs like Elizabeth Falkner are moving to Brooklyn to make their NYC debuts. Her pizzeria, Krescendo, has grabbed the entire pizza-crazy city's attention. Court Street Grocers takes on the deli sandwich.

1.title: Comfort Food
1.plot: Eateries in New York City are visited, including a meatball restaurant; a restaurant serving chicken and waffles; an eco-friendly hot-dog place.

2.title: Meats
2.plot: Meat specialties are sampled, including the burgers at "Minetta Tavern" in New York.

3.title: Desserts
3.plot: Babycakes lures you in with the sweet smell of treats. Also: a pie shop in Brooklyn that sells individual slices; an ice-cream truck for artisanal ice cream.

4.title: Gastropubs
4.plot: Gastropub's drink list may be long, but the dining is the reason to visit. Included: a place that serves hot dogs and hash browns; and a place that specializes in charcuterie.

5.title: Hand-Held Eats
5.plot: Hand-held meals are discussed, including Mexican street food and the grilled-cheese sandwich.

6.title: Adventure
6.plot: Take a gastro-tour of some of the most adventurous efforts in dining today, including a nine-course underground dinner party in Chicago; a double-decker bus serving gourmet meals; and sushi prepared from freshly killed fish.

7.title: Food Fantasy
7.plot: Check out these amazing dining spots, where food and fantasy meet, including "WD-50" in New York City; and the "Bazaar", a Spanish restaurant in Los Angeles.

8.title: Americana
8.plot: Classic American fare gets the royal treatment at these distinctive spots. The foods include heavy metal-inspired burgers, Brooklyn barbecue and Los Angeles hot-spot desserts.

9.title: Great Spaces
9.plot: We take a tour of the most unique places and spaces in dining today. Included: a food truck serving Korean-Mexican dishes.

10.title: Italian
10.plot: Check out some of the most unique Italian restaurants in the country, including "Vetri" in Philadelphia; and "Pulino's" and "Porchetta" in New York City.

16.title: Ice Cream
16.plot: Ice cream is the subject. Included: bourbon and corn-flake-flavored ice cream at "Humphrey Slocombe" in San Francisco; the "Sweet Rose Creamery" in Santa Monica, Cal. and pink-peppercorn ice cream at the "Dairy Godmother" in Alexandria, Va.

1.title: Brunch
1.plot: Unusual brunch places are visited, including a do-it-yourself pancake house; and an Italian-style brunch.

2.title: Late-Night Eats
2.plot: These are eateries that serve food late into the night, and they are definitely worth staying up late for.

3.title: Cupcakes
3.plot: Unique cupcakes, including cupcakes paired with beer & wine; custard-filled cupcakes; a design-your-own-frosting cupcake place.

4.title: Southern Favorites
4.plot: Southern food, including spicy chicken; a Sunday-brunch menu.

5.title: Burgers
5.plot: Come see what's between the buns at these burger joints that are taking the American classic to the next level. Included: foie gras burgers in Philadelphia; burger with truffles in New York; and pimento cheeseburgers in Atlanta.

6.title: Sandwiches
6.plot: Unusual sandwiches are sampled in New York, California, Massachusetts, Oregon and North Carolina.

7.title: Chocolate
7.plot: Chocolate treats are displayed, including chocolate fleur de set toffee; whoopie pies; and chocolate sea-salt crostatas.

8.title: Extreme Farm to Table
8.plot: Farm-to-table dining spots are visited. Included: "Blue Hill at Stone Barns" in Tarrytown, N.Y.; and "Dinners at the Farm" in Madison, Connecticut.

9.title: Street Food
9.plot: Street food, including Thai dishes in Portland; chicken and porchetta in San Francisco; and coconut-jam sandwiches in Los Angeles.

10.title: Drinks
10.plot: Places with unusual drinks are visited, including a coffee boutique; a beer restaurant; a Mexican eatery featuring margaritas; and a gin joint.

11.title: Cheese
11.plot: Cheese is the subject. Included: fondue and cheesecake in New York City; a macaroni-and-cheese dish in Connecticut; grilled-cheese sandwiches in San Francisco.

13.title: Small Plates
13.plot: The unique flavors are the big appeal at these hot-spots. Mexican dishes are sampled. Also: Italian food in New York.

2.title: Asian
2.plot: At Pubbelly, the pig's big in Asian-inspired ways at this gastropub.

3.title: Delis
3.plot: New York's Little Italy; Gourmet deli in Los Angeles; Hot dogs in North Carolina; Delicatessen classics in Chicago

4.title: Pubs
4.plot: Pull up a barstool at these unique pubs, where the food is delicious and daring.

5.title: Pizza
5.plot: Pizza is the subject, including "Jane" in Montreal; "Domenica" in New Orleans; "Great Lake" in Chicago; and "Motorino" in Brooklyn.

6.title: Barbecue
6.plot: Barbecued food is the subject, including a North Carolina pit master; brisket in Austin, Texas; three New Orleans brothers who make barbecue tacos and smoked-pork cakes.

7.title: Neighborhood Gems
7.plot: Neighborhood eateries, including "Willie Mae's Scotch House" in New Orleans; "Garde Manger" in Montreal; "Hominy Grill" in Charleston.

8.title: Chicken
8.plot: Whether you like it fried, roasted, grilled or smoked, we've got a chicken dish you will want to sink your teeth into.

9.title: Cheap Eats
9.plot: If you're hungry for big flavors w/o breaking the bank, these unique cheap eats will deliver, including tacos in Chicago; a Cambodian sandwich shop in New York; and a Venezuelan restaurant in Williamsburg, N.Y. Also: hot dogs and sausages.

10.title: Bistros
10.plot: You don't have to go all the way to Europe to have the best bistro fare. Unique Eats visits Los Angeles, Boston, South Carolina and New York in this episode.

11.title: Lunch Spots
11.plot: Favorite lunch spots are visited, including "M. Wells" in Long Island City, New York; the "Parish Café" in Boston; "Valencia Luncheria" in Norwalk, Connecticut; and "Boucherie" in New Orleans, Louisiana.

12.title: Fried Food
12.plot: Fried foods, including poutine, fish and chips in Montreal; fried risotto balls in Brooklyn; doughnuts in Austin.

13.title: Wine Bars
13.plot: Simple, rustic Italian dishes shine at Terroir in Tribeca, New York. At the Purple Pig in Chicago, a chef impresses with his Mediterranean menu. At Cochon Butcher in New Orleans, shop for provisions and then have a delicious bite.

1.title: Queens
1.plot: Taste your way through Queens, New York, and experience something culturally diverse and utterly unique.

2.title: Between the Bun
2.plot: Forget the traditional hamburger, these meals between with bun are truly unique.

3.title: Mexican
3.plot: We discover amazing Mexican food, with a twist. Dive into a Mexican brunch in Boulder, Colorado. Then find out how one chef in New York is really breaking the mold. Feast on small delicacies in Washington D.C.

4.title: Bar Food
4.plot: When you're out having a drink, you gotta have food to soak it up. So why not dig into something beautifully prepared, utterly unique? Bar food includes a hearty steak and kidney pie; chicken wings.

5.title: Eat & Sleep
5.plot: We travel across the country to visit great getaways where the food is just as worthy of the trip as the lodging itself. Included: a luxury seaside spa and restaurant; a romantic hideaway nestled in the woods; a summer camp for adults.

6.title: Maine Weekend
6.plot: Maine is the great American vacation spot, and a fantastic food destination. Let us plan your weekend of eating at a Portland farm to table legend, dive into unique lobster rolls, stay a while at a resort serving innovative fare.

7.title: Comfort Foods
7.plot: Eateries in New York City are visited, in the opener of this series examining unusual dining establishments throughout the country. Included: a meatball restaurant; a restaurant serving chicken and waffles; an eco-friendly hot-dog place.

8.title: Wine Country Weekend
8.plot: Excite your palate with a gastronomical weekend in Napa Valley, California's Wine Country. Indulge in fried chicken at the more casual sister restaurant of a local legend.

9.title: Local Legends
9.plot: These are eateries that have quickly become famous food destinations. These eateries are in Cleveland, Baltimore, San Francisco and Ogunquit, Maine.

10.title: Dirt Cheap & Delicious
10.plot: We're off to Cleveland Ohio for a pulled pork PBLT and squash dumplings; Brooklyn, New York for an outdoor food market with a bevy of satisfying BBQ and biscuits, Washington D.C. for spicy Asian fare.

11.title: Food by Fire
11.plot: This celebration takes food back to its roots - cooked by open flames, but in new and inspiring ways. Included: Dungeness crab, flame-licked skewers and treats from a wood-burning oven.

12.title: Portland Weekend
12.plot: Spend a food-filled weekend in Portland, Oregon, where up and coming innovators meet local legends.

13.title: Pasta
13.plot: Forget ordinary pasta with red sauce. In this show, we visit restaurants that are turning out pasta dishes like nothing you've ever tasted before, in cities like San Francisco, Boulder, New York and Seattle.

14.title: Philadelphia Weekend
14.plot: We spend a weekend in the Brotherly Love and discover some truly unique eats. From exciting Spanish tapas to gut-busting Philly-style sandwiches -- you'll feel as though you have tasted your way across the world.

24.title: Vegas
24.plot: Everyone knows Vegas for its bright lights, humming slot machines, and big shows. But if you play your cards right, you can also eat at some of the most interesting, delicious and unique restaurants.

1.title: Eat Your Veggies
1.plot: We travel from the east coast to the west, discovering restaurants that are creating truly innovative dishes with vegetables. This isn't just about a healthy diet, this is about completely changing the way you eat your veggies.

2.title: Craving Comfort
2.plot: Dive into the most unique variations of some of your favorite comfort foods, including Japanese nachos; fois gras doughnuts; chocolate and bacon cupcakes.

3.title: Seafood
3.plot: Take a tour of restaurants with unique takes on seafood standards, including oysters from Philadelphia; potpie from Portland; a one-of-a-kind fish sandwich.

4.title: Hot Spots
4.plot: Find out what the buzz is all about at hot dining spots across the country. They food range from Chinese dishes to American fare.

5.title: Nostalgic Noshes
5.plot: Join us for a trip down memory lane as we discover restaurants serving dishes that reminiscent of the old days, but with a deliciously modern twist.

6.title: Romantic Spots
6.plot: We tour the Big Apple, dipping into eateries that are perfect for you and that special someone.

7.title: Global
7.plot: From New York to Las Vegas to Philadelphia, we meet chefs who are creating extraordinary dishes that will make you feel as though you've traveled to another continent.

8.title: Houston Weekend
8.plot: Spend 36 hours in Houston with us for a unique culinary tour of the most innovative restaurants, featuring dishes such as beef plates and spicy Tex-Mex mash-ups.

9.title: Mash-Ups
9.plot: We're celebrating the best of all worlds with restaurants that mix different ethnic traditions to create new and unique flavors.

10.title: Hot & Spicy
10.plot: We're visiting hot spots around the country that are literally spicing it up in the kitchen.

11.title: Off the Grid
11.plot: From authentic Italian on Staten Island to pizza in Las Vegas and icy treats in Hawaii, you will visit extraordinary eateries, that are unknown to the average tourist.

12.title: Vegas Weekend
12.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

13.title: Polynesian Paradise
13.plot: We're taking a trip to the 50th state for an indulgent culinary weekend. Find out which chefs and which restaurants make Hawaii a true foodie destination.

imdb.title: Unique Eats
plot: They travel across the country to find the most unique and exciting dishes in America.::Anonymous
